titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Office of Global Services RG.12.2.3
titlestmt.author: Nicole Greenhouse

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-07-09 14:29:07 UTC.

did.unittitle: Records of the Office of Global Services
did.abstract: The Office of Global Services (OGS) at New York University handles immigration matters for students, faculty, and staff seeking immigration and visa support when traveling to NYU locations in the United States and around the world. The Supporting Our Global Community webpage, created in 2025, details resources available for international students at New York University, as well as links to information for international students related to the United States policies on immigration.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued quarterly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by crawl date.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Records of the Office of Global Services; RG 12.2.3; Wayback URL; New York University Archives, New York University.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/supportingourinternationalstudentsandscholars.html was selected by curator Janet Bunde in April 2025. The accession number associated with this website is 2025.029.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Supporting Our Global Community webpage, created in 2025, details resources available for international students at New York University, as well as links to information for international students related to the United States policies on immigration.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of Global Services (OGS) at New York University handles immigration matters for students, faculty, and staff seeking immigration and visa support when traveling to NYU locations in the United States and around the world. In 2025, in response to the changing policies implemented by the Trump administration, OGS created a webpage to monitor any proposals, laws, and actions relevant to the NYU international community.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The finding aid was created in Summer 2025 and description was created according to DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description. The collection was maintained by Nicole Greenhouse. Maintenance of the collection consisted of rescoping due to missing captured content, redirects and content drift, missing embedded materials (such as videos or attached Google documents and pdfs), and other materials.

daodesc.p: Supporting Our Global Community Archived Website: April 2025-ongoing
